org.usb4java

Class BufferUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usb4java.BufferUtils

  • public final class BufferUtils
extends Object
    Provides some utility methods for working with IntBuffer and ByteBuffer.
    Author:
    Luca Longinotti (l@longi.li)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ByteBuffer allocateByteBuffer(int bytes)
      Allocates a new direct ByteBuffer with the specified size and returns it.
      static IntBuffer allocateIntBuffer()
      Allocates a new IntBuffer with space for exactly one integer value.
      static LongBuffer allocateLongBuffer()
      Allocates a new LongBuffer with space for exactly one long value.
      static ByteBuffer slice(ByteBuffer buffer, int offset, int length)
      Slices a part of the specified ByteBuffer into a new byte buffer and returns it.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • allocateByteBuffer

        public static ByteBuffer allocateByteBuffer(int bytes)
        Allocates a new direct ByteBuffer with the specified size and returns it.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The size of the new byte buffer.
        Returns:
        The allocated direct byte buffer.

      • allocateIntBuffer

        public static IntBuffer allocateIntBuffer()
        Allocates a new IntBuffer with space for exactly one integer value.
        Returns:
        The allocated int buffer.

      • allocateLongBuffer

        public static LongBuffer allocateLongBuffer()
        Allocates a new LongBuffer with space for exactly one long value.
        Returns:
        The allocated long buffer.

      • slice

        public static ByteBuffer slice(ByteBuffer buffer,
                               int offset,
                               int length)
        Slices a part of the specified ByteBuffer into a new byte buffer and returns it.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The byte buffer to slice data from.
        offset - The offset of the part to slice.
        length - The length of the part to slice.
        Returns:
        The new byte buffer with the sliced part.
